drivers.name: Block Bridge iSCSI
drivers.description: Volume driver.

drivers.name: Ceph RADOS Block Device (RBD)
drivers.description: The Ceph RADOS Block Device volume driver allows to use Ceph RADOS block devices (RBD) for volumes.

drivers.name: XenAPINFS volume driver
drivers.description: XenAPINFS is a Block Storage (Cinder) driver that uses an NFS share through the XenAPI Storage Manager to store virtual disk images and expose those virtual disks as volumes. This driver does not access the NFS share directly. It accesses the share only through XenAPI Storage Manager. Consider this driver as a reference implementation for use of the XenAPI Storage Manager in OpenStack (present in XenServer and XCP).

drivers.name: Cloud Byte iSCSI volume driver
drivers.description: Volume driver for Cloud Byte iSCSI

drivers.name: Windows Server iSCSI Cinder driver
drivers.description: Windows iSCSI volume back-end driver for Windows Server 2012 and above.

drivers.name: Windows SMB3 Cinder driver
drivers.description: SMB3 volume back-end driver for Windows Server 2012 and above.

drivers.name: Linux SMB3 Cinder driver
drivers.description: SMB3 volume back-end driver for Linux.

drivers.name: CloudFounders Open vStorage driver
drivers.description: The driver allows to configure the OpenStack Block Storage service for use with CloudFounders Open vStorage appliance. Open vStorage is an open-source software defined storage VM storagerouter, a layer in between Virtual machines and storage backends. It is compatible with Swift (via S3) interface as backend and nova compute nodes as frontend, it serves volumes via a virtual filesystem using .raw files. Multiple Storage Routers can coordinate between them and allow live migration with near-zero copy (only local cache is synced).

drivers.name: Coho Data driver
drivers.description: The Coho DataStream Scale-Out Storage allows your Block Storage service to scale seamlessly. The architecture consists of commodity storage servers with SDN ToR switches. Leveraging an SDN OpenFlow controller  allows you to scale storage horizontally, while avoiding storage and network bottlenecks by intelligent load-balancing and parallelized workloads.

drivers.name: CoprHD FC driver
drivers.description: The CoprHD FC driver supports FC block storage via the CoprHD open source software-defined storage controller and API platform.

drivers.name: CoprHD iSCSI driver
drivers.description: The CoprHD iSCSI driver supports iSCSI block storage via the CoprHD open source software-defined storage controller and API platform.

drivers.name: CoprHD ScaleIO driver
drivers.description: The CoprHD ScaleIO driver supports ScaleIO Data Client connected volumes via the CoprHD open source software-defined storage controller and API platform.

drivers.name: Coraid AoE driver
drivers.description: The driver allows to configure the OpenStack Block Storage service for use with Coraid storage appliances. Coraid storage appliances use the low-latency ATA-over-Ethernet (ATA) protocol to provide high-bandwidth data transfer between hosts and data on the network.

drivers.name: Datera iSCSI Volume driver
drivers.description: Datera Volume driver can allow OpenStack services communicate with Datera EDF storage for both vHost and ISCSI.

drivers.name: Dell EqualLogic iSCSI volume driver
drivers.description: The Dell EqualLogic volume driver interacts with configured EqualLogic arrays and supports various operations, such as volume creation and deletion, volume attachment and detachment, snapshot creation and deletion, and clone creation.

drivers.name: Dell Storage Center iSCSI volume driver
drivers.description: The Dell Storage Center volume driver interacts with configured Storage Center arrays and supports various operations, such as volume creation and deletion, volume attachment and detachment, snapshot creation and deletion, and clone creation.

drivers.name: Dell Storage Center FC volume driver
drivers.description: The Dell Storage Center volume driver interacts with configured Storage Center arrays and supports various operations, such as volume creation and deletion, volume attachment and detachment, snapshot creation and deletion, and clone creation.

drivers.name: EMC ScaleIO
drivers.description: The EMC ScaleIO driver supports ScaleIO Data Client connected volumes by using ScaleIO REST API.

drivers.name: EMC VMAX FC driver
drivers.description: The EMC VMAX FC driver runs volume operations by communicating with the back-end VMAX storage, using the EMC SMI-S Provider.

drivers.name: EMC VMAX iSCSI driver
drivers.description: The EMC VMAX iSCSI driver runs volume operations by communicating with the back-end VMAX storage, using the EMC SMI-S Provider.

drivers.name: EMC VNX FC driver
drivers.description: The EMC VNX FC direct driver runs volume operations by communicating with the back-end VNX storage, using NaviSecCLI.

drivers.name: EMC VNX iSCSI driver
drivers.description: The EMC VNX iSCSI direct driver runs volume operations by communicating with the back-end VNX storage, using NaviSecCLI.

drivers.name: EMC XtremIO FC driver
drivers.description: The XtremIO FC driver enables OpenStack clouds to access the XtremIO storage. The XtremIO Cinder driver directs the creation and deletion of volumes on the XtremIO storage and attaches or detaches volumes to/from OpenStack instances or virtual machines (VMs).

drivers.name: EMC XtremIO iSCSI driver
drivers.description: The XtremIO iSCSI driver enables OpenStack clouds to access the XtremIO storage. The XtremIO Cinder driver directs the creation and deletion of volumes on the XtremIO storage and attaches or detaches volumes to/from OpenStack instances or virtual machines (VMs).

drivers.name: Fujitsu Eternus DX FC Volume driver
drivers.description: This driver supports ETERNUS DX S3 series and runs volume operations by communicating with the backend Fujitsu storage. It uses a CIM client in Python called PyWBEM to perform CIM operations over HTTP.

drivers.name: Fujitsu Eternus DX ISCSI Volume driver
drivers.description: This driver supports ETERNUS DX S3 series and runs volume operations by communicating with the backend Fujitsu storage. It uses a CIM client in Python called PyWBEM to perform CIM operations over HTTP.

drivers.name: Fusion-io Control Volume driver
drivers.description: This driver will allow Cinder to interact with the Fusion-io ioControl Hybrid storage array.

drivers.name: GlusterFS driver
drivers.description: This driver enables use of GlusterFS in a similar fashion as the NFS driver. It supports basic volume operations together with snapshot/clone ones.

drivers.name: HP 3PAR Fibre Channel driver
drivers.description: The HP 3PAR StoreServ Fibre Channel Block Storage (Cinder) driver to provision volumes with an HP 3PAR StoreServ array and attach volumes over Fibre Channel.  The driver communicates over HTTP, HTTPS, and SSH connections.

drivers.name: HP 3PAR iSCSI driver
drivers.description: The HP 3PAR StoreServ iSCSI Block Storage (Cinder) driver to provision volumes with an HP 3PAR StoreServ array and attach volumes over iSCSI.  The driver communicates over HTTP, HTTPS, and SSH connections.

drivers.name: HP LeftHand StoreVirtual driver
drivers.description: The HP StoreVirtual driver can be configured to run in one of two possible modes, legacy mode which uses SSH/CLIQ to communicate with the HP StoreVirtual Storage, or standard mode, which uses a new REST client to communicate with the array.

drivers.name: HPE 3PAR Fibre Channel driver
drivers.description: The Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) 3PAR StoreServ Fibre Channel Block Storage (Cinder) driver to provision volumes with an HPE 3PAR StoreServ array and attach volumes over Fibre Channel.  The driver communicates over HTTP, HTTPS, and SSH connections.

drivers.name: HPE 3PAR iSCSI driver
drivers.description: The Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) 3PAR StoreServ iSCSI Block Storage (Cinder) driver to provision volumes with an HPE 3PAR StoreServ array and attach volumes over iSCSI.  The driver communicates over HTTP, HTTPS, and SSH connections.

drivers.name: HPE LeftHand StoreVirtual driver
drivers.description: The Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) StoreVirtual driver can be configured to run using a REST client to communicate with the array.

drivers.name: HDS HNAS iSCSI and NFS driver
drivers.description: This Block Storage volume driver provides iSCSI and NFS support for HNAS (Hitachi Network-attached Storage) arrays such as, HNAS 3000 and 4000 family.

drivers.name: HDS iSCSI volume driver
drivers.description: This Block Storage volume driver provides iSCSI support for HUS (Hitachi Unified Storage) arrays such as, HUS-110, HUS-130, and HUS-150.

drivers.name: Hitachi iSCSI/FC storage volume driver
drivers.description: This Block Storage volume driver provides iSCSI and Fibre Channel support for Hitachi storages such as, VSP G1000 (Virtual Storage Platform G1000), VSP (Virtual Storage Platform), HUS VM (Hitachi Unified Storage VM), and HUS 100 Family (Hitachi Unified Storage 100 Family).

drivers.name: Huawei ISCSI/FC volume driver
drivers.description: The Huawei driver supports the iSCSI and Fibre Channel connections and enables OceanStor TV2 storage, OceanStor V3 series storage, and OceanStor 18000 high-end storage to provide block storage services for OpenStack.

drivers.name: IBM GPFS volume driver
drivers.description: The GPFS driver enables the use of GPFS to provide efficient and scalable storage for Cinder volumes.  With the GPFS driver, instances do not actually access a storage device at the block level.  Instead, volume backing files are created in a GPFS file system and mapped to instances, which emulate a block device.  The GPFS storage is accessed from compute nodes using either a GPFS or NFS client.

drivers.name: IBM NAS NFS volume driver
drivers.description: The IBM NAS Driver works using NFS protocol, and implements other value added features. It allows IBM SONAS and Storwize V7000 Unified filers and NFS based GPFS storage system deployments to provide block storage for OpenStack environment.

drivers.name: IBM Storwize family and SVC iSCSI/FC volume driver
drivers.description: The volume management driver for Storwize family and SAN Volume Controller (SVC) provides OpenStack Compute instances with access to IBM Storwize family or SVC storage systems.

drivers.name: IBM XIV/DS8K iSCSI/FC volume driver
drivers.description: The IBM XIV/DS8K volume driver is installed on OpenStack Cinder nodes and enables utilization of storage resources provided by IBM XIV and DS8000 storage systems.

drivers.name: Kaminario K2 All-Flash iSCSI/FC
drivers.description: The Kaminario iSCSI/FC Cinder volume drivers interacts with configured K2 All-Flash arrays(iSCSI/FC) and supports various operations, such as volume creation and deletion, volume attachment and detachment, snapshot creation and deletion, and clone creation.

drivers.name: Generic Block Device volume driver
drivers.description: For generic local block device usage.

drivers.name: NetApp Unified Driver
drivers.description: The NetApp Unified Driver for Cinder provides integration for multiple storage controller families and protocols. A storage family corresponds to storage systems built on different NetApp technologies such as clustered Data ONTAP, 7-Mode, and NetApp E-Series and EF-Series systems. The storage protocol refers to the protocol used to initiate data storage and access operations to those storage systems.  Clustered Data ONTAP systems can be used with Cinder via Parallelized NFS (pNFS), NFS, iSCSI, and Fibre Channel storage protocols. 7-mode systems can be used with NFS, iSCSI, and Fibre Channel. E-Series and EF-Series systems are accessible via iSCSI and Fibre Channel.

drivers.name: Nexenta drivers
drivers.description: NexentaStor Appliance is NAS/SAN software platform designed for building reliable and fast network storage arrays. NexentaStor can serve as a storage node for the OpenStack and its virtual servers through iSCSI and NFS protocols.

drivers.name: Nimble Storage iSCSI Volume driver
drivers.description: Nimble Storage is hybrid storage combining both flash SSD and near-line SAS disks. The architecture is based on CASL (Cache Accelerated Sequential Layout) where random writes are coalesced in NVRAM + flushed to disks sequentially, with the flash/SSD as read acceleration cache. CASL architecture provides non-disruptive upgrade for compute (processer/memory), cache (flash SSDs), capacity (disk shelves) as well as scale-out where up to four nodes of Nimble controllers can be clustered.

drivers.name: LVM
drivers.description: The default volume back-end uses local volumes managed by LVM. This driver supports different transport protocols to attach volumes, currently ISCSI and ISER.

drivers.name: NFS
drivers.description: The Network File System (NFS) is a distributed file system protocol. An NFS server exports one or more of its file systems, known as shares. An NFS client can mount these exported shares on its own file system. File actions on this mounted remote file system can be performed as if the file system were local.

drivers.name: SheepDog Volume Driver
drivers.description: Sheepdog is an open-source distributed storage system that provides a virtual storage pool utilizing internal disk of commodity servers. This driver enables use of Sheepdog through QEMU/KVM.

drivers.name: ZFS Storage Appliance iSCSI/NFS driver
drivers.description: Cinder Driver support for Oracle's ZFS Storage Appliance product line. It's an iSCSI driver that uses REST API to communicate out of band with the storage controller.

drivers.name: ProphetStor iSCSI/FC volume driver
drivers.description: ProphetStor Fibre Channel and iSCSI drivers add support for ProphetStor Flexvisor through OpenStack Cinder. ProphetStor Flexvisor enables commodity x86 hardware as software-defined storage leveraging well-proven ZFS for disk management to provide enterprise grade storage services such as snapshots, data protection with different RAID levels, replication, and deduplication etc.

drivers.name: Volume driver for Pure Storage FlashArray storage system
drivers.description: Pure Storage builds all-flash storage arrays. The active/active controller architecture is based on the Purity Operating Environment and providing an adaptive metadata fabric that is scalable, granular to 512B, and protected. Pure systems are based on durable, resilient MLC flash and providing consistent high performance. Pure Storage FlashArrays leverage deduplication and compression technologies to reduce data written thereby lowering costs and increasing density. FlashArrays are designed for non-disruptive operations and can be upgraded or expanded without disruption or performance degradation.

drivers.name: Quobyte RemoteFS volume driver
drivers.description: Volume driver for Quobyte software defined storage system. Quobyte storage runs on plain Linux servers and allows reconfiguration at runtime without storage service interruption. Storage behaviour is fully configurable via policies which also control automation and hardware independent configuration.

drivers.name: Scality SOFS driver
drivers.description: The driver manages volumes on the Scality SOFS filesystem. This gives OpenStack users the option of storing their data on a Scality Ring object storage cluster.

drivers.name: Scality iSCSI REST Block volume driver
SolidFire Driver
drivers.description: The SolidFire Cluster is a high performance all SSD iSCSI clustered storage device, providing IOP's based QoS. The driver allows to configure the use of a SolidFire cluster with Block Storage.

drivers.name: Tegile IntelliFlash Volume Driver
drivers.description: Tegile IntelliFlash arrays leverage the performance of flash technology while using hard disk drives to lower cost per GB

drivers.name: Tintri Volume Driver
drivers.description: Tintri VMstore is a smart storage that sees, learns and adapts for cloud and virtualization

drivers.name: VMware VMDK Driver
drivers.description: The VMware VMDK driver to enable management of the OpenStack Block Storage volumes on vCenter-managed data stores. Volumes are backed by VMDK files on data stores that use any VMware-compatible storage technology such as NFS, iSCSI, FiberChannel, and vSAN.

drivers.name: X-IO ISE Block Storage iSCSI/FC
drivers.description: The ISE from X-IO Technologies is a block storage element supporting Fibre Channel and iSCSI. The volume driver from X-IO allows the cloud administrator to provision volumes on connected ISEs taking advantage of QoS, Media affinity, etc.

drivers.name: Zadara VPSA Cloud Block Storage
drivers.description: There is a volume back-end for Zadara.

drivers.name: 6WIND Virtual Accelerator plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: 6WIND Virtual Accelerator Fuel Plugin extends Mirantis Openstack to run 6WIND Virtual Accelerator on compute nodes for high-performance networking

drivers.name: Xenserver plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: XenServer Fuel Plugin will help to deploy Mirantis OpenStack over XenServer hosts and make sure they work as xenapi rather than qemu.

drivers.name: ScaleIO Cinder plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: The ScaleIO plugin for Fuel extends Mirantis OpenStack functionality by configuring a external EMC ScaleIO cluster as the default volume backend for the OpenStack environment.

drivers.name: ScaleIO plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: The ScaleIO plugin for Fuel extends Mirantis OpenStack functionality by deploying a EMC ScaleIO cluster and configuring it as the default volume backend for the OpenStack environment.

drivers.name: EMC VNX plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: EMC VNX plugin for Fuel extends Mirantis OpenStack functionality by adding support for EMC VNX arrays in Cinder using iSCSI protocol. It replaces Cinder LVM driver which is the default volume backend that uses local volumes managed by LVM. Enabling EMC VNX plugin in Mirantis OpenStack means that all Cinder services are run on Controller nodes.

drivers.name: XtremIO plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: The EMC XtremIO plugin for Fuel adds support for EMC XtremIO arrays in Cinder using iSCSI protocol

drivers.name: Juniper Contrail Networking plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin enables configuration and deployment of the Juniper Contrail Networking SDN. This plugin can also be used with OpenContrail.

drivers.name: Cinder Kaminario Plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Fuel plugin that enables to configure multiple Cinder backend support for Kaminario K2 All-Flash Array.

drivers.name: ConnectX-3 Pro Network Adapter Support plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin configures support for Mellanox ConnectX-3 Pro network adapters, enabling high-performance SR-IOV compute traffic networking, iSER (iSCSI) block storage networking, or (as of Mirantis OpenStack 6.1) Infiniband networking. This plugin configures support for Mellanox ConnectX-3 Pro network adapters, enabling high-performance SR-IOV compute traffic networking, iSER (iSCSI) block storage networking, or Infiniband networking.

drivers.name: Midonet plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Fuel MidoNet plugin is capable of deploying MidoNet v2015.06.

drivers.name: GlusterFS plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Enables GlusterFS driver in Cinder for your GlusterFS cluster.

drivers.name: Elasticsearch-Kibana plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Part of the Logging, Monitoring and Alerting (LMA) toolchain, this plugin deploys Elasticsearch server and the Kibana web interface, used primarily for filtering and analyzing deep system logs and notifications.

drivers.name: Ldap plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin extends Mirantis OpenStack functionality by adding LDAP support. It allows to use an existing LDAP server as authentication backend for Keystone. Plugin supports configuration of Ldap proxy on Openstack controller, also it supports setting Keystone to use Ldap over TLS.

drivers.name: EMC hardware monitoring to Zabbix plugin
drivers.description: EMC hardware monitoring extension plugin extends Zabbix plugin functionality by adding monitoring of incoming SNMP traps sent from EMC VNX arrays via management network to management VIP address. It configures snmptt to parse and pass EMC VNX specific traps to Zabbix.

drivers.name: Extreme Networks hardware monitoring to Zabbix plugin
drivers.description: This plugin extends Zabbix plugin functionality by adding monitoring of incoming SNMP traps sent from Extreme Networks hardware via management network to management VIP address.

drivers.name: FWaaS plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin enables OpenStack Firewall-as-a-Service, which uses iptables to apply firewall policy to all networking routers in a project, effectively creating a project-based perimeter firewall. FWaaS is thus distinct from Security Groups, which work at the instance level.

drivers.name: Murano Networking SFC plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin extends Mirantis OpenStack functionality by adding to Murano Networking SFC support.

drivers.name: Networking SFC plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin extends Mirantis OpenStack functionality by adding Networking SFC support.

drivers.name: InfluxDB-Grafana plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Part of the Logging, Monitoring and Alerting (LMA) Toolchain, this plugin deploys InfluxDB server and the Grafana web interface. These components are used primarily for databasing and analysis of metrics that change over time (metric time-series).

drivers.name: LBaaS plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Note, that the plugin has no failover of load-balanced objects and HTTPS termination.

drivers.name: OpenDaylight Plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This is a proof of concept of the plugin which will install OpenDaylight controller and set it as manager for OVS using ovsdb plugin.

drivers.name: SNMP plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: SNMP trap daemon plugin extends Zabbix plugin functionality by adding ability to receive SNMP traps from management network and pass them to Zabbix.

drivers.name: The Logging, Monitoring And Alerting (LMA) Collector plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Installed on OpenStack controller, compute, and storage nodes, this module collects logs, metrics and notifications from system and OpenStack services and forwards that information to external backend databases such as Elasticsearch and InfluxDB.

drivers.name: VPNaaS plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This Neutron extension introduces a flexible IPSec VPN feature-set supported by Neutron CLI and, more simply, in Horizon, by adding a new set of tabs to Network. VPNs can be easily and quickly implemented to connect groups of VMs on separate subnets, either within the same cloud or between clouds, across network or internet.

drivers.name: Zabbix Monitoring plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin deploys Zabbix, the leading open source enterprise monitoring and analysis solution. The Zabbix UI is installed on a controller and Zabbix agents are deployed to monitor all OpenStack nodes (plus the OpenStack APIs), their configurations further optimized to monitor specific services on each node.

drivers.name: Ceilometer Redis plugin
drivers.description: This plugin deploys Redis, which used by Ceilometer's agents for workload partitioning

drivers.name: Detach RabbitMQ plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin allows to install RabbitMQ on dedicated nodes

drivers.name: Kafka Fuel plugin
drivers.description: This plugin allows to install Kafka on dedicated nodes

drivers.name: Manila plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: That plugin provides usage the Manila (File Share as a Service) capabilities whithin an Mirantis OpenStack environment.

drivers.name: OpenStack Telemetry plugin
drivers.description: This plugin uses Ceilometer's agents for data polling, hindsight/heka for data processing and InfluxDB/ES for data storage

drivers.name: NetApp plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: NetApp – This Fuel Plugin enables use of NetApp’s NFS driver as a Cinder back-end with Clustered Data ONTAP-based NetApp FAS storage systems (CDOT), 7-Mode systems, and performance-optimized SANtricity-based NetApp E Series storage systems.

drivers.name: SolidFire plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: The SolidFire plugin for Fuel extends Mirantis OpenStack functionality by adding support for SolidFire clusters in Cinder using iSCSI protocol. It replaces Cinder LVM driver which is the default volume backend that uses local volumes managed by LVM. Enabling the SolidFire plugin in Mirantis OpenStack means that all Cinder services are run on Controller nodes.

drivers.name: Fuel plugin for Nuage SDN
drivers.description: Provides the functionality to Integrate Nuage SDN with Mirantis OpenStack

drivers.name: PLUMgrid plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This Fuel plugin installs the PLUMgrid core neutron plugin in collaboration with PLUMgrid ONS to provide the entire network backend for Mirantis OpenStack.

drivers.name: Calico plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin provides Calico's Layer 3 Virtual Networking for Highly Scalable Data Centers

drivers.name: Pure Storage plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Pure Storage plugin for Fuel adds support for Pure Storage FlashArray block storage array. The Pure Storage FlashArray is an iSCSI capable block storage device used as a Cinder backend.

drivers.name: QLogic FastLinQ Ethernet SR-IOV Fuel plugin
drivers.description: QLogic Fuel Plugin installs and configures SR-IOV functionality on FastLinQ Ethernet Adapters

drivers.name: Swiftstack plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: SwiftStack plugin for Fuel provides the functionality to integrate SwiftStack Swift cluster as object storage backend option.

drivers.name: Openbook plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Deploys Openbook for billing/invoicing, chargeback/showback, and customer lifecycle management for OpenStack.

drivers.name: Tesora DBaaS Platform plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: Tesora Database as a Service (DBaaS) platform is an enterprise-hardened version of OpenStack Trove, the native database service for OpenStack.

drivers.name: VMware NSX plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: VMware NSX plugin for Fuel allows deployment of Mirantis OpenStack with VMware NSX software defined networking platform.  It allows to use Neutron with OpenStack that utilize vSphere computing (ESXi) clusters.

drivers.name: VMware DVS plugin for Fuel
drivers.description: This plugin enables deployment of Mirantis OpenStack with VMware vCenter. It allows to use Neutron for management VMware vSphere Distributed Virtual Switch with OpenStack that utilize vSphere computing (ESXi) clusters.

drivers.name: pxe_drac
drivers.description: This driver is for the Dell Remote Access Controller and uses pxe to deploy.

drivers.name: agent_irmc driver
drivers.description: This driver enables Virtual Media deploy with IPA (Ironic Python Agent) and power control via ServerView Common Command Interface (SCCI).

drivers.name: iscsi_irmc driver
drivers.description: This driver enables Virtual Media deploy with image build from Diskimage Builder and power control via ServerView Common Command Interface (SCCI).

drivers.name: pxe_irmc driver
drivers.description: This driver enables PXE deploy and power control via ServerView Common Command Interface (SCCI).

drivers.name: iscsi_ilo
drivers.description: The iscsi_ilo driver from HPE utilizes HPE's integrated lights-out management facilities, in conjunction with an iSCSI-based deploy mechanism. It does not use PXE.

drivers.name: pxe_ilo
drivers.description: The pxe_ilo driver from HPE utilizes HPE's integrated lights-out management facilities, in conjunction with PXE/iSCSI for deployment (just like normal PXE driver) but support automatic setting of requested boot mode from nova. This driver doesn't require iLO Advanced license.

drivers.name: agent_ilo
drivers.description: The agent_ilo driver from HPE utilizes HPE's integrated lights-out management facilities. It uses virtual media to boot up the Ironic Python Agent (IPA) on the baremetal node instead of using PXE.

drivers.name: iscsi_pxe_oneview
drivers.description: The HPE OneView driver for Ironic enables the users of OneView to use Ironic as a bare metal provider to their managed physical hardware. The iscsi_pxe_oneview driver implement the core interfaces of an Ironic Driver, and use the python-oneviewclient to provide communication between Ironic and OneView through OneView’s Rest API

drivers.name: agent_pxe_oneview
drivers.description: The HPE OneView driver for Ironic enables the users of OneView to use Ironic as a bare metal provider to their managed physical hardware. The agent_pxe_oneview driver implement the core interfaces of an Ironic Driver, and use the python-oneviewclient to provide communication between Ironic and OneView through OneView’s Rest API

drivers.name: pxe_ipminative
drivers.description: pxe_ipminative is like the pxe_ipmitool driver, but substitutes IBM's 'pyghmi' library, a native python IPMI utility, for the generic ipmitool package.

drivers.name: agent_ssh
drivers.description: agent_ssh is a testing driver, which combines the ironic-python-agent deploy mechanism with SSH-based power control to enable upstream CI.

drivers.name: agent_ipmitool
drivers.description: agent_ipmitool uses the ironic-python-agent project for advanced provisioning functionality not available with the PXE driver. This driver is tested on the x86 and Power (ppc64) architectures.

drivers.name: pxe_ipmitool
drivers.description: pxe_ipmitool is the recommended default driver for Ironic in Icehouse and Juno. This driver is tested on the x86 and Power (ppc64) architectures.

drivers.name: pxe_ssh
drivers.description: pxe_ssh is a testing driver, which combines the PXE deploy mechanism with SSH-based power control to enable upstream CI.

drivers.name: pxe_iscsi_cimc
drivers.description: pxe_iscsi_cimc is an Ironic pxe boot + iscsi deployment driver for C series UCS running in standalone mode

drivers.name: pxe_ucs
drivers.description: pxe_ucs is an Ironic pxe boot + iscsi deployment driver for UCS B and C under UCSM

drivers.name: Windows SMB Driver,
drivers.description: The Windows SMB Driver for Manila manages SMB file shares on Windows Server 2012 and above. The driver supports both Manila driver modes (driver_handles_share_servers = True/False).

drivers.name: EMC Isilon Manila Driver
drivers.description: The Isilon Manila driver is a plugin for the EMC Manila driver framework which allows Manila to interface with an Isilon backend to provide a shared filesystems. The driver supports Manila driver mode (driver_handles_share_servers = False).

drivers.name: EMC Unity Manila Driver
drivers.description: The Unity Manila driver is a plugin for the EMC Manila driver framework which allows Manila to interface with a Unity backend to provide shared filesystems. The driver supports Manila driver mode (driver_handles_share_servers = True).

drivers.name: EMC VNX Manila Driver
drivers.description: The VNX Manila driver is a plugin for the EMC Manila driver framework which allows Manila to interface with a VNX backend to provide shared filesystems. The driver supports Manila driver mode (driver_handles_share_servers = True).

drivers.name: HP 3PAR Driver
drivers.description: The HP 3PAR Shared File Systems (Manila) driver provisions shares with HP 3PAR StoreServ Storage with the HP 3PAR File Persona Software Suite. The driver communicates over HTTP, HTTPS, and SSH connections.

drivers.name: HPE 3PAR Driver
drivers.description: The Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) 3PAR Shared File Systems (Manila) driver provisions shares with HPE 3PAR StoreServ Storage with the HPE 3PAR File Persona Software Suite. The driver communicates over HTTP, HTTPS, and SSH connections.

drivers.name: HDS HNAS NFS driver
drivers.description: This Shared File-system Service driver provides NFS support for HNAS (Hitachi Network-attached Storage) arrays such as, HNAS 3000 and 4000 family.

drivers.name: Huawei Manila Driver
drivers.description: Huawei Manlia driver is a plug-in based on the Shared File Systems service. The Huawei Manila driver can be used to provide functions such as the share and snapshot for virtual machines, or instances, in OpenStack. Huawei Manila driver enables the OceanStor V3 series V300R002 or higher storage systems to provide only network filesystems for OpenStack.

drivers.name: NetApp Unified Driver
drivers.description: The NetApp Unified Driver for Manila manages NFS and CIFS file shares on NetApp Clustered Data ONTAP storage controllers.  The driver supports both Manila driver modes (driver_handles_share_servers = True/False).

drivers.name: Quobyte Manila Driver
drivers.description: The Quobyte Manila driver provides access to shared storage residing on a Quobyte volume.

drivers.name: Tegile Manila Driver
drivers.description: Tegile driver for Manila provides access to NFS and CIFS shares in Tegile IntelliFlash arrays. The driver supports Manila driver mode (driver_handles_share_servers = False).

drivers.name: A10 Networks LBaaS Driver
drivers.description: A10 Network Driver is specifically designed to manage Thunder Series Appliances.

drivers.name: Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Omniswitch ML2 Mechanism Driver
drivers.description: Networking-ale-omniswitch package contains Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Omniswitch vendor code for Openstack Neutron.

drivers.name: Arista Neutron ML2 Driver
drivers.description: Arista ML2 Mechanism Driver implement ML2 Plugin Mechanism Driver API. This driver can manage all types of Arista switches.

drivers.name: Big Switch Neutron ML2 Driver
drivers.description: An ML2 Mechanism Driver to integrate ML2 deployments into Big Switch/Floodlight controlled networks. This driver only controls physical infrastructure so it is meant to be combined with the openvswitch mechanism driver.

drivers.name: Big Switch Controller Plugin
drivers.description: Floodlight can be run as the network backend for OpenStack using a Neutron plugin. Neutron exposes a networking-as-a-service model via a REST API that Floodlight has implemented.

drivers.name: Brocade Neutron plugin
drivers.description: Brocade Neutron Plugin for VDX/VCS provides a means to interface Openstack's Networking to orchestrate Brocade's physical switches.

drivers.name: Brocade Neutron ML2 Mechanism driver for VDX/VCS Switches
drivers.description: Brocade Neutron ML2 Mechanism Driver for VDX/VCS provides a means to interface Openstack Networking to orchestrate Brocade physical switches.

drivers.name: Brocade Vyatta
drivers.description: CI for Brocade Vyatta vRouter Plugins

drivers.name: CSR1kv router service plugin
drivers.description: A Cisco service plugin that implements Neutron L3 router API for CSR1kv VMs.

drivers.name: Neutron ML2 Driver For Cisco Nexus Devices
drivers.description: The Cisco Nexus ML2 Mechanism Driver implements the ML2 Plugin Mechanism Driver API. This driver manages multiple types of Cisco Nexus switches.

drivers.name: Cisco APIC ML2 Driver
drivers.description: The Cisco APIC ML2 Mechanism driver provides Neutron's core API abstraction to be implemented against an ACI fabric.

drivers.name: Cisco APIC L3 Service
drivers.description: The Cisco APIC L3 service provides Neutron's L3 API abstraction to be implemented against an ACI fabric.

drivers.name: Cisco VPNaaS
drivers.description: The Cisco VPNaaS provides VPN IPsec site-to-site connections using the Cisco Cloud Services Router.

drivers.name: Cisco Nexus 1000V Plugin
drivers.description: Cisco Nexus 1000V is a state-of-the-art virtual switch for datacenters. This plugin implements the Neutron core APIs and integrates with the Nexus 1000V control and data planes.

drivers.name: NetScaler LBaas driver
drivers.description: The NetScaler loadbalancer integration in Neutron LBaaS implements all the LBaaS driver CRUD APIs defined in the IceHouse release: It implements all the defined operations on VIPs, Pools, Pool Members and Health Monitors. The integration consists of a driver class configured in the Neutron config file (neutron.conf), and the accompanying unit tests.

drivers.name: Cloudbase Hyper-V ML2 Agent
drivers.description: The Hyper-V Neutron ML2 agent offers the networking options for Hyper-V Server based OpenStack installations.

drivers.name: Embrane Neutron Plugin
drivers.description: Embrane Neutron plugin enables users to interface Neutron with the Embrane heleos platform.

drivers.name: Embrane LBaaS Driver
drivers.description: Embrane LBaaS driver enables heleos load balancing services using Neutron's API.

drivers.name: Extreme Networks Plugin
drivers.description: The Extreme Networks OpenStack plugin runs on Extreme XOS 15.3 and later releases. This plug-in is supported on all EXOS based platforms and includes the latest OpenStack API capabilities. The Extreme Networks OpenStack 2.0 plugin enables "Networking-as-a-Service" for both Physical and Virtual Extreme Networks.

drivers.name: Freescale SDN ML2 Mechanism Driver
drivers.description: Freescale SDN ML2 Mechanism Driver is designed to support Cloud Resource Discovery Service (CRD).

drivers.name: Freescale FWaaS Plugin
drivers.description: Freescale FWaaS Plugin is designed to support Cloud Resource Discovery Service (CRD).

drivers.name: FUJITSU Converged Fabric Switch ML2 driver
drivers.description: FUJTISU Converged Fabric Switch ML2 driver implements the ML2 Plugin Mechanism Driver API. This driver manages multiple types of FUJITSU Converged Fabric Switches.

drivers.name: Huawei Agile Controller Neutron Plugin
drivers.description: Huawei Agile Controller extends neutron's functionalities and enables the orchestration of network-wide resources in support of application services.

drivers.name: IBM SDN-VE Plugin
drivers.description: This plugin implements Neutron v2 APIs by using IBM-SDNVE controller.

drivers.name: Juniper Networks plug-in for OpenStack Neutron
drivers.description: The Juniper Networks plug-in for OpenStack Neutron enables orchestration of virtual and physical network configurations. The plug-in supports Junos Space Network Director API (NDAPI) as well as NETCONF/DMI to configure the physical network.

drivers.name: Juniper Opencontrail plugin for Neutron resources
drivers.description: Opencontrail is open source network virtualization solution. It uses standards based BGP L3VPN closed user groups to implement virtual networks.

drivers.name: KEMP Technologies LBaaS V2 Driver
drivers.description: KEMP Technologies LBaaS V2 driver that will allow the use of KEMP appliances as the back end

drivers.name: Mellanox Neutron Plugin
drivers.description: The Openstack Mellanox Neutron plugin supports Mellanox embedded switch functionality as part of the VPI (Ethernet/InfiniBand) HCA. Mellanox Neutron Plugin allows hardware vNICs (based on SR-IOV virtual functions) per each Virtual Machine vNIC to have its unique connectivity, security, and QoS attributes.

drivers.name: Mellanox Neutron ML2 Driver
drivers.description: The Openstack Mellanox Neutron ML2 Driver supports Mellanox embedded switch functionality as part of the VPI (Ethernet/InfiniBand) HCA. Mellanox ML2 Driver allows hardware vNICs (based on SR-IOV virtual functions) per each Virtual Machine vNIC to have its unique connectivity, security, and QoS attributes.

drivers.name: Mellanox Neutron ML2 SR-IOV Driver
drivers.description: The Openstack Mellanox Neutron ML2 SR-IOV Driver supports Mellanox embedded switch functionality as part of the VPI (Ethernet/InfiniBand) HCA. Mellanox Neutron ML2 SR-IOV Driver allows hardware vNICs (based on SR-IOV virtual functions) per each Virtual Machine vNIC to have its unique connectivity, security, and QoS attributes.

drivers.name: MidoNet Plugin
drivers.description: MidoNet Neutron plugin enables MidoNet virtual networking technology for those using OpenStack Neutron cloud networking orchestration.

drivers.name: VMware DVS Neutron ML2 Driver
drivers.description: VMware DVS Neutron ML2 plugin driver enables integration of OpenStack with VMware vCenter. It allows to use Neutron for management VMware vSphere Distributed Virtual Switch.

drivers.name: Nuage Networks Neutron Plugin
drivers.description: Nuage Networks OpenStack networking plugin enables integration of OpenStack with Nuage Networks Virtual Service Platform (VSP).

drivers.name: Nuage Networks ML2 driver
drivers.description: Nuage Networks OpenStack ML2 plugin driver enables integration of OpenStack with Nuage Networks Virtual Service Platform (VSP).

drivers.name: One Convergence NVSD Controller
drivers.description: One Convergence Neutron plugin provides Neutron APIs for the network virtualization solution implemented with One Convergence Network Virtualization and Services Delivery(NVSD) Controller.

drivers.name: ONOS ML2 MechanismDriver and L3 plugin
drivers.description: ONOS controller facilitates neutron's ML2 and L3 functionalities. Controller side has well defined northbound APIs to interact with Neutron. For realizing ML2 functionality the controller uses OVSDB (Open vSwitch Database Management) protocol to configure vSwitches on compute nodes. For L3 functionality the controller simulates a new router by extending neutron's router functionality.

drivers.name: OpenDaylight ML2 MechanismDriver
drivers.description: OpenDaylight has driver for Neutron ML2 (Modular Layer 2) plugin to enable communication between Neutron and OpenDaylight. On the SDN controller side, OpenDaylight has northbound APIs to interact with Neutron and use OVSDB (Open vSwitch Database Management Protocol) for southbound configuration of vSwitches on compute nodes. Thus OpenDaylight can manage network connectivity and initiate GRE or VXLAN tunnels for compute nodes.

drivers.name: Linux Bridge Plugin
drivers.description: Neutron Linux Bridge plugin configures a Linux Bridge to create Neutron Network, Port, and Attachment abstractions. Plugin manages VLANs.

drivers.name: Modular Layer 2 Plugin
drivers.description: The ML2 plug-in is a core plug-in working as part of the OpenStack Neutron Virtual Network Service

drivers.name: Meta Plugin
drivers.description: The Meta Plug-in allows you to use multiple plug-ins at the same time.

drivers.name: OpenFlow Agent
drivers.description: The OpenFlow Agent (aka. ofagent) and the associated ML2 Mechanism Driver controls OpenFlow switches as a part of OpenStack Neutron.

drivers.name: Open vSwitch Plugin
drivers.description: The Open vSwitch plug-in is a core plug-in working as part of the OpenStack Neutron Virtual Network Service.

drivers.name: PLUMgrid OpenStack Networking Suite Neutron Plugin
drivers.description: PLUMgrid Neutron Plugin enables PLUMgrid Open Networking Suite which is a secure comprehensive and open software solution that delivers terabits of performance and scales across tens of thousands of workloads.

drivers.name: Calico ML2 Driver
drivers.description: Calico (http://www.projectcalico.org/) uses IP routing to provide connectivity between the workloads in a data center that provide or use IP-based services - whether VMs, containers or bare metal appliances; and iptables, to impose any desired fine-grained security policy between those workloads. Calico thus differs from most other Neutron backends, which use bridging and tunneling to simulate L2-level connectivity between the VMs attached to a Neutron network.

drivers.name: Radware LBaaS Driver for Alteon.
drivers.description: Radware LBaaS Driver provides load balancing as a service based on Alteon, enabling on demand provisioning of load balancing capacity, overlay network agnostic, overlay gateway bypass, high availability, tenant isolation and SLA guarantee.

drivers.name: Tail-f NCS ML2 Mechanism Driver
drivers.description: The Tail-f NCS Mechanism Driver allows OpenStack to drive the Tail-f Network Control System (NCS) so that NCS can provision a multi-vendor network in response to Neutron configuration changes.

drivers.name: VMware NSX Network Virtualization Platform Plugin
drivers.description: The NSX plug-in is designed to manage VMware NSX platform, formerly known as Nicira NVP.

drivers.name: vArmour-Firewall
drivers.description: The vArmour driver is used to configure vArmour firewall as FWaaS in OpenStack environment.

drivers.name: Hyper-V virtualization platform
drivers.description: It is possible to use Hyper-V as a compute node within an OpenStack Deployment. The nova-compute service runs as openstack-compute, a 32-bit service directly upon the Windows platform with the Hyper-V role enabled.

drivers.name: kvm_ppc64
drivers.description: KVM for the IBM Power ppc64 platform. Supported features are listed in the nova hypervisor support matrix.

drivers.name: Ironic driver
drivers.description: Compute driver for Ironic (Bare Metal Provisioning) program, enabling Nova to provision physical machines. Built during Icehouse within the Ironic tree, it was moved to Nova's tree during Juno.

drivers.name: KVM
drivers.description: KVM is configured as the default hypervisor for Compute.

drivers.name: LXC (Linux Containers)
drivers.description: LXC (Linux containers) is a virtualization technology that works at the operating system level. LXC (as currently implemented using libvirt in the Compute service) is not a secure virtualization technology for multi-tenant environments.

drivers.name: QEMU
drivers.description: From the perspective of the Compute service, the QEMU hypervisor is very similar to the KVM hypervisor. The main difference is that QEMU does not support native virtualization.

drivers.name: XenAPI
drivers.description: XenAPI compute driver connects to XenServer hypervisors via XenAPI. Used to power Rackspace Cloud Servers (Public Cloud).

drivers.name: Xen+Libvirt
drivers.description: Support for the Xen hypervisor when used with libvirt.

drivers.name: VMware vSphere
drivers.description: OpenStack Compute supports the VMware vSphere product family. The VMware vCenter driver enables the nova-compute service to communicate with a VMware vCenter server that manages one or more ESX host clusters.

drivers.name: Hortonworks Data Platform Plugin
drivers.description: The Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) Sahara plugin provides a way to provision HDP clusters on OpenStack using templates in a single click and in an easily repeatable fashion.

drivers.name: MapR plugin
drivers.description: The MapR Distribution provides a full Hadoop stack that includes the MapR File System (MapR-FS), MapReduce, a complete Hadoop ecosystem, and the MapR Control System user interface

drivers.name: Spark Plugin
drivers.description: Spark plugin provides an ability to launch Spark on Hadoop CDH cluster without any management consoles.

drivers.name: Vanilla Plugin
drivers.description: Vanilla plugin is a reference plugin implementation which allows to operate with cluster with Apache Hadoop.

drivers.name: Cloudera Plugin
drivers.description: Cloudera plugin provides an ability to launch CDH clusters with Cloudera Manager management console.
